attributes.action: To get a crossing or speed bumps in the road
attributes.additional_details: After seeing a little hit by a car on this really busy road something has to change so dangerous cars speed down this road way to fast not safe kids. Woodway lane Coventry 21/06/21
attributes.background: To help kids be safe getting home eaither a crossing or spread bumps along the road so car can't speed down this road for kids to get hit walking home from school

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local road improvements are a matter for your local authority, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://www.coventry.gov.uk/petitions
